crisis.name: Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster (Japan nuclear meltdown)

org.name: FEMA
org.foundingMission: Support and protect citizens including during disaster or recovery
org.majorEvents: First establishment of a federal emergency management in U.S. by Congressional Act of 1803

org.name: International Medical Corps
org.foundingMission: Provide relief and aide through health care training and programs

org.name: Mercy Corps
org.foundingMission: Provide aide during disasters to communities in need through donations and entrepeneurship programs
org.majorEvents: Founded by Dan ONeill to aide refugees during the time of the Killing Fields in Cambodia

org.name: Salvation Army
org.foundingMission: Spread religious message and aide those in need, particularly the poor and homeless
org.majorEvents: Founded by William Booth and his wife to preach their message and help the poor

org.name: Japan Society
org.foundingMission: Promotion and appreciation of the Japanese culture
org.majorEvents: Increased Japanese cultural awareness in 20th century, playing a larger role during political crises and disasters

org.name: UNICEF
org.foundingMission: Response to childrens' plight during WWII

org.name: U.S. Coast Guard
org.foundingMission: Founded by Congress. Ready today. Prepared for tomorrow.

org.name: U.S. Marine Corps
org.foundingMission: Provide power projection from the sea.

org.name: United Nations
org.foundingMission: UN was made in 1945 at the end of World War II to replace the League of Nations

org.name: American Red Cross
org.foundingMission: Founded by Clara Barton on May 21, 1881 as a means to provide disaster relief

org.name: US Coast Guard
org.foundingMission: Founded in 1790 as the Revenue Marine

org.name: Federal Reserve
org.foundingMission: Created December 23, 1913 with the Federal Reserve Act
